intro: Iris aitchisonii, commonly known as Aitchison's iris, is a striking perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of northern Pakistan. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing three upright petals and three drooping sepals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
